[{"id":"QCT-1522","entityId":"66-5575","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"1.7.0_RC5 System hangs when browsing to setup page while having Open AMIP enabled."},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"created","value":"1589867098008"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1522"},{"name":"description","value":"

Changing "support open amip" to "enable open amip" har gjort så att systemet kraschar när man kommer till setup sidan.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589867102623"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"QCT-1127","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"gma","fullName":"Govan Marounsi"}]}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"QCT-1127","entityId":"66-3625","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Add support for OpenAMIP"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Mikael Borin"},{"name":"created","value":"1541593539370"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1127"},{"name":"description","value":"
OpenAMIP will be used to integrate external modems that supports it. E.g iDirect X5 or X7. The M&C of the QCT is connected to modem using ethernet. The terminal will then obtain information such as lock and signal level.

**Here will port the functionality already present in the CCT!**

A new modem type will be available in the Setup. No parameters shall be present in the Setup, instead all OpenAMIP parameters shall be configurable from a dialog accessible from the admin page.

These parameters include:

  • Open AMIP TCP Port
  • Open AMIP UDP Port

Add support for these OpenAMIP commands as per OpenAMIP standard version 1.9 dated August 18, 2016.

Commands sent from Modem:
W - Where (location) Interval. float repeat interval, seconds.
L - Lock status of receiver. binary 1 (locked) or 0 (unlocked) and binary TX Enable: 1 (Tx on) or 0 (Tx off)
C - Carrier to Noise ratio. float CNR (SNR) in dB, measured on pilots and float CNR (SNR) in dB, measured
on data.
A - Alive interval (s message). int interval, seconds.

Commands sent from QCT Controller M&C interface:
w - Latitude, Longitude and Time parameter. float latitude/longitude (degrees) and float time (time in seconds since GPS epoch.)
a - alive interval (L message). int repeat interval, seconds
c - The antenna may request periodic carrier-to-noise estimates (C message) by setting the fifth parameter (Hz).
s - status of antenna. binary Antenna Functional: (1 - antenna functional) and Binary Modem May Transmit: (1 - Modem may transmit [QCT BUC = Unmuted] or 0 - Modem must not transmit [QCT BUC = Muted]).
"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Govan RX (modem/beacon) Pol for pointing"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Jonas Lindberg"},{"name":"created","value":"1588840249537"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1486"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"jln"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589810739253"},{"name":"resolved","value":"1589535336038"},{"name":"Type","value":["Feature Request"],"valueId":["Feature Request"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["System Test"],"valueId":["System Test"],"color":{"bg":"#0050a1","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Release","value":["1.7.0"],"valueId":["1.7.0"],"color":null},{"name":"Fixed in RC","value":["RC7"],"valueId":["RC7"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.7"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.7"],"color":null},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["120"],"valueId":["2h"],"color":null},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"Capture.JPG","id":"85-1580","url":"http://dps-sw-youtrack.corp.datapath.com:8999/_persistent/Capture.JPG?file=85-1580&c=true"}]}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"QCT-1477","entityId":"66-5467","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Incorrect button state on webserver in GUI after installation"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"created","value":"1588232713396"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1477"},{"name":"description","value":"

If the Admin dialog is opened directly after a software update, the webserver is displayed as "Off", however, the webserver is actually running.

If the webserver is set to "On" in the GUI, the webserver is stopped. Thus, to ensure that the state of the webserver matches the state of the button the user has to select "On" then "Off" and finally "On" again.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589810739252"},{"name":"resolved","value":"1589472925024"},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["System Test"],"valueId":["System Test"],"color":{"bg":"#0050a1","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Release","value":["1.7.0"],"valueId":["1.7.0"],"color":null},{"name":"Fixed in RC","value":["RC7"],"valueId":["RC7"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.7"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.7"],"color":null},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["960"],"valueId":["2d"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"83-6275","author":"boj","authorFullName":"Bengt-Ove Johansson","issueId":"QCT-1477","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Affected Hardware Configuration (IDs for TU, NP, AS, CU, AUX)

TU Ku 6W

Affected Software Version(s)

1.7.0 RC1

Problem Description

With beacon level test connected to a sign gen at IF (1448.5MHz) i found that 1 of 3 beacon didn't have lock in the tuning page.
Power cycle fixed the issue.
It must be some kind of timing issue when the beacon module is started.

The issue happened and I downloaded files from the system.
This was with the Beacon fix that never turn off the sampling, with this SW I got the fault 2 of 3 times.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1587650837228,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-6264","author":"mad","authorFullName":"Magnus Andersson","issueId":"QCT-1468","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

With RC2 I have never seen this and I have switched on and off quite alot of times....

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1588152207021,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-6274","author":"boj","authorFullName":"Bengt-Ove Johansson","issueId":"QCT-1468","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

There are exceptions in the logs. Investigate those exceptions. And see what we've done that might have remedied the problem in RC2.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1588671783303,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-6308","author":"vse","authorFullName":"Viktor Selleby","issueId":"QCT-1468","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

As this issue seemed to have been fixed without any reason in RC2 it was probably caused by there being multiple units with beacon on the same network.

Moving this to verified so that it can be tested again in the next RC with the new knowledge that only one QCT can be on a single network at the time.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1589529015535,"updated":1589529039375,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"QCT-1459","entityId":"66-5407","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Make allowed beacon frequency in setup file dependent on selected Lnb"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"created","value":"1587468893256"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1459"},{"name":"description","value":"

If a typo is made in the beacon frequency field when creating a setup file, it is currently difficult to detect. The allowed beacon frequency should span from min lnb lo + 950 000 000 to max lnb lo + 2 000 000 000.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589810739252"},{"name":"resolved","value":"1589791978174"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"QCT-1517","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"}]},{"name":"Type","value":["Usability Problem"],"valueId":["Usability Problem"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["System Test"],"valueId":["System Test"],"color":{"bg":"#0050a1","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Release","value":["1.7.0"],"valueId":["1.7.0"],"color":null},{"name":"Fixed in RC","value":["RC7"],"valueId":["RC7"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.7"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.7"],"color":null},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["120"],"valueId":["2h"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"83-6312","author":"vse","authorFullName":"Viktor Selleby","issueId":"QCT-1459","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
A quick fix has been implemented where values between 7.0GHZ and 21.2GHz are accepted. A default value of 10.7 GHz has been set to avoid forcing the user to enter a value if beacon is not used as signal source. The default value should be restored to 0 again once QCT-1517 is implemented.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1589792302136,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"QCT-1520","entityId":"66-5569","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Change Beacon 10MHz suppression to -77"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"created","value":"1589808014057"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1520"},{"name":"description","value":"
As false locks were seen on a system with Ku-band transceiver the suppression factor has to be increased. The values seen on the system were around -78.
"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"markdown","value":"false"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589810391730"},{"name":"resolved","value":"1589808014065"},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["Won't fix"],"valueId":["Won't fix"],"color":null},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.7"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.7"],"color":null},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["60"],"valueId":["1h"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"83-6313","author":"vse","authorFullName":"Viktor Selleby","issueId":"QCT-1520","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

The problems that caused this change were most likely caused by something other than 10MHz. It has been decided that the 10MHz suppression limit should remain at -80 until QCT-1521 has been completed.

If result of some commands and requests sent to Qlite is not successful, then Qlite will send and error message beginning with "!". Right now we are not using this information and just ignore it. We can read this information and save it in a property with name of error message (We can add the name of rule to the beginning of the error message.). We have to check which commands sent back error message and add this to all of them.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589796939005"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"QCT-1518","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"QCT-1360","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"QCT-1268","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.7"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.7"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"gma","fullName":"Govan Marounsi"}]},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["1440"],"valueId":["3d"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"83-6300","author":"vse","authorFullName":"Viktor Selleby","issueId":"QCT-1498","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1589287690361,"updated":1589288388654,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[{"value":"Has ToDo in CodeBase","cssClass":"c4"}]}, {"id":"QCT-1268","entityId":"66-4069","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Full support for Q-Lite"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Bengt-Ove Johansson"},{"name":"created","value":"1558511409551"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1268"},{"name":"description","value":"
This will add the possibility to select predefined slots containing configurations (from now on these shall be called configuration memory).

A configuration memory is identified by a text string. The administrator shall configure the modem and save its setting into a configuration memory with a certain name using the web interface of the modem. This name must then be entered into the Setup of the QCT to be used. There shall be a new field in the QLite Setup where the administrator shall be able to add a comma separated list of names.

There shall also be a field specifying the default configuration memory.

These names shall then be available in a dialog. This dialog can be accessed from a button in the lower parts of the QCT screen between the alarm button and the right button. This means that it shall be possible for the operator to choose a new configuration memory at any time.

This dialog shall contain a scrollable list of the names of the configuration memories that were specified by the administrator in the Setup. The operator selects a new configuration memory by tapping on the corresponding name.

This means that it will not be possible to install a previous version where the database version is less than the current one.

For instance, in 1.4 the database version is 4. In 1.5 the version will be 5. So it will be possible to upgrade from 1.4 to 1.5 but not downgrade from 1.5 to 1.4.

Affected Hardware Configuration (IDs for TU, NP, AS, CU, AUX)

CU

Affected Software Version(s)

Urgency

Urgent

Problem Description

The SDRPlay RSP2 receiver that is being used as Beacon receiver. Supplier is referring to that the RSPdx is the replacement unit.
A quick test with a Pi3 flash image showed that its not direct compatible, Pi3 with the RSPdx didnt started correctly.

See the home page for more details
https://www.sdrplay.com/rspdx/

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"mad"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"4"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589535747260"},{"name":"resolved","value":"1589535747249"},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Minor"],"valueId":["Minor"],"color":{"bg":"#e6e6e6","fg":"#888"}},{"name":"State","value":["Verified"],"valueId":["Verified"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Edition","value":["Normal Edition"],"valueId":["Normal Edition"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"Branch","value":["maintenance-2.19"],"valueId":["maintenance-2.19"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"83-6120","author":"boj","authorFullName":"Bengt-Ove Johansson","issueId":"DEV-2885","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

At the bottom of the page it says:

Please note, the RSPdx will only work with SDRuno running on Windows initially, and SDRuno is needed to unlock the full features of the RSPdx.

On another page (https://www.sdrplay.com/some-guidance-for-linux-and-gnu-radio-users/) they say that the RSPdx only can be used with API 3.06 and we're currently using 2.1x, so we need to upgrade the application to that API. Another page states that the 3.06 for Raspberry Pi is in Open Beta for Developers only which indicates that there might still be problems with that version.

I think the best way forward is to try with the new API. Then we need to decide how we should support the two different versions in the software.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1578582452662,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-6121","author":"mad","authorFullName":"Magnus Andersson","issueId":"DEV-2885","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

I have asked about the Linux support and they refer back to this webpage update.
https://www.sdrplay.com/happy-new-year-and-an-rspdx-update/

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1578639409242,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-6132","author":"mad","authorFullName":"Magnus Andersson","issueId":"DEV-2885","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

SDRPlay has another proposal, the RSP1A is a updated product with the same performance as the RSP2. The board size is only 2mm wider and fit into our screen box.
The RSP1A is supported with our existing driver 2.13. First test has shown that its probably feasible to have a SW to support both the RSP2 and RSP1A.
The RSP1A HW ID=255 and it doesnt support external reference or multiple inputs.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1579858440858,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-6309","author":"vse","authorFullName":"Viktor Selleby","issueId":"DEV-2885","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Support has been implemented and briefly tested. Has to be verified in a real system.

After new software is installed via the web gui the CPU usage of the system is unreasonably high 95-99% even though the system is idle.

If a reboot is performed, either via power cycle or adb reboot, the idle CPU usage on a board drops to 4-5%.

Investigate what causes this. If no other solution is found a possible fix could be to always reboot the system after installation is completed.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"2"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589468836763"},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["Ready"],"valueId":["Ready"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Blocked"],"valueId":["Blocked"],"color":{"bg":"#8d5100","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.7"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.7"],"color":null},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["1440"],"valueId":["3d"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"83-6293","author":"boj","authorFullName":"Bengt-Ove Johansson","issueId":"QCT-1491","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
